name: Haesun Park
content: Professor Haesun Park - Georgia Tech Experiences Research Publications SmallK: Open Source NMF Software in Python/C++ NMF and NTF in Matlab Haesun Park Office: CODA Building Phone: 404-385-2170 Fax: 404-385-7337 Email: hpark@cc.gatech.edu Current Regents' Professor and Chair, Computational Science and Engineering SIAM Fellow Class of 2013 IEEE Fellow Class of 2017 ACM Fellow Class of 2020 Education Ph.D. in Computer Science, 1987 (minor: Mathematics), Cornell University, Ithaca, NY M.S. in Computer Science, 1985, Cornell University, Ithaca, NY B.S. (Summa Cum Laude) in Mathematics, 1981, Seoul National University, Seoul, Korea Positions Held Chair, School of Computational Science and Engineering, Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA, August 2020 - present Regents' Professor, School of Computational Science and Engineering, Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA, July 2019 - present Professor, School of Computational Science and Engineering, Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA, July 2005 - present Director, NSF/DHS FODAVA-Lead (Foundations of Data and Visual Analytics), 2008-2014 Executive Director, CDA  (Center for Data Analytics), 2013-2015 Program Director, Division of Computing and Communication Foundations, National Science Foundation, Arlington, VA, 2003 - 2005 Dept. of Computer Science and Engineering, University of Minnesota, Twin Cities, MN Professor: 1998 - 2005, Associate Professor: 1993 - 1998, Assistant Professor: 1987 - 1993 KIAS Scholar, Division of Computational Sciences, Korea Institute for Advanced Study (KIAS), Seoul, Korea, 2008 - 2018 Georgia Tech Home   | GT College of Computing   | National Science Foundation   | Department of Homeland Security
